description.narrative: Output 1.3: Parents, caregivers, children and adolescents have improved knowledge and skills on key healthy practices,which contributes to Child Health, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Children, adolescents and women have equitable access to and use improved and quality, high-impact maternal, neonatal and child health interventions and adopt healthy life practices.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 617/618 Diplomatic Drive Central Business District PMB 2851 Garki Abuja

sector.narrative: Child health policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development

UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

2016 Nigeria: Evaluation of the Maternal Newborn and Child Health Week in Nigeria

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.3: Parents, caregivers, children and adolescents have improved knowledge and skills on key healthy practices

description.narrative: Focus has been on generating evidence on the status of 5 key family practices, to establish a viable tracking system for these behaviours in specific focus geo-political locations and determine the contribution of UNICEF to shifts in practices that ultimately define health and wellbeing among children and women in Nigeria | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: A comprehensive RMNCAH communication plan (incorporating malaria, pneumonia and diarrhoea, PMTCT, immunisation, polio and child development) is developed, budgeted and implemented
Mothers and caregivers with knowledge of at least 5 of the UNICEF essential family practices
